title: The best President’s Day sales happening now
author: Alice Newcome-Beill
content:
President’s Day is here, and while it was originally established as a holiday to celebrate the birthday of George Washington, the passage of time has transformed it into a day when we distract ourselves from the foibles of our democratically elected leadership by treating ourselves to some of the best deals of the year.

Whether you’re planning to get a little something for yourself or shopping for someone else, there are plenty of great promotions and sales to take advantage of for the remainder of the long weekend. Many products — including the Samsung Galaxy Buds 2, LG’s C1 OLED, and Razer BlackWidow V3 Mini — are currently matching their lowest prices ever, while others are just shy of it.

Below, we’ve rounded up the best President’s Day deals we could find. A number of the promotions and sales are likely to linger beyond the actual holiday, too, so check back here and subscribe to the Verge Deals newsletter for all the highlights later this week.

Headphones and earbuds deals

  • Samsung’s Galaxy Buds 2 include active noise cancellation and boast an improved design and fit in comparison to their predecessor. They normally retail for $149.99, but you can buy them right now in select colors for $107.38 at Amazon or for $110 at Samsung, two of their lowest prices to date. Read our review.
  • Bose’s QuietComfort 45 are back down to $279 at Amazon, Adorama, and Target, one of the best prices we’ve seen on the exceptional pair of noise-canceling headphones, which offer superb sound and best-in-class comfort. Read our review.
  • Another earbud option from Samsung; the unique, bean-like Galaxy Buds Live are $99.99 ($70 off) at Best Buy and Samsung. It’s not the cheapest price we have ever seen on these noise-canceling earbuds, but it’s a good deal for a great set of Bluetooth buds. Read our review.
  • The UE FITS from Ultimate Ears are selling for $169 as a part of the company’s President’s Day sale. That’s an $80 discount on a pair of sweat-resistant, wireless earbuds that are designed to mold to the shape of your ears in 60 seconds. Read our review.
  • Jabra’s Elite 75t wireless earbuds are available for $99.99 instead of $179.99 at Best Buy. That’s an $80 discount on a pair of comfortable earbuds that offer great sound quality and the ability to connect to two Bluetooth devices simultaneously. Read our review.

TV deals

  • The LG C1, one of the best TVs for gaming, is currently on sale for its Black Friday price at multiple retailers. Amazon, B&H Photo, and Newegg are currently selling the 55-inch model for around $1,297 instead of $1,499.99. The popular TV sports a 120Hz refresh rate, Dolby Vision compatibility, and support for HDMI 2.1.
  • Samsung’s The Frame displays customizable wall art but, when turned on, transforms into a smart 4K TV with Amazon Alexa built-in and a 120Hz refresh rate. Right now, Samsung is selling the 55-inch for $999.99 as a part of its ongoing President’s Day sale, which is around the same price we saw it for during Black Friday. Amazon, B&H Photo, and Best Buy are also offering roughly the same discount.
  • If you want an OLED TV but the C1 is a little too expensive, LG’s 55-inch entry-level A1 OLED is selling for around $1,097 ($200 off) at B&H Photo, Amazon, Target, GameStop, Best Buy, and Newegg, which is an all-time low.
  • Amazon’s 55-inch Omni Fire 4K TV is selling for $369.99 instead of $559.99 on Amazon, which is now a new all-time low that beats its Black Friday price by $40. The larger configurations — which include support for Dolby Vision HDR — are on sale as well, with the 65-inch going for $499.99 instead of $829.99 and the 75-inch now just $749.99 instead of $1,099.99. All of these are their lowest prices to date. Read our review.

Laptop deals

  • The Microsoft Surface Pro 8 is currently available with its Type Cover for the lowest price we’ve seen in the past several months. Normally $1,239.98, Microsoft’s modern touchscreen device is on sale right now at Best Buy for $999.98 with an 11th Gen Intel Core i5 CPU, 8GB of RAM, and 128GB of storage. Read our review.
  • The 17-inch LG Gram 17, the best laptop for fans of big screens, may be large but is actually quite lightweight. It typically retails for $1,849.99, but right now, Amazon is selling the device for $1,519.23, its best price to date. The $330 discount is available on the model equipped with an Intel Core i7 processor, 16GB of RAM, and a 1TB SSD. Read our review.
  • The Asus ROG Zephyrus M16 GU603 is $1,549.99 ($300 off) at Best Buy right now with an Intel Core i9 CPU, an RTX 3060 GPU, a 1TB SSD, and 16GB of RAM. Its 16-inch screen has a 16:10 aspect ratio, too, making it well-suited for productivity and not just gaming. Read our review

Apple deals

  • The 41mm, GPS-equipped Apple Watch Series 7 is $50 off ($349) at Amazon, as is the 45mm variant ($379). We were impressed by Apple’s latest watch, which offers a larger display than its predecessor, faster charging, and IP6X dust resistance. Read our review.
  • Apple’s latest entry-level, 256GB iPad is $449 ($30 off) at Walmart. The 2021 iPad offers a new, faster A13 Bionic chip and a 12MP front camera that supports the Center Stage feature, which can automatically follow you within the frame during video calls.
  • Apple’s AirPods Pro, which offer great noise cancellation and deep integration with iOS, are currently discounted at Amazon. Normally, the AirPods Pro sells for $249.00, and while they haven’t been that price in some time, their current sale price of $174.98 is the best deal you can find right now on Apple’s high-end true wireless earbuds. Read our review.
  • The new 14- and 16-inch MacBook Pros are powerhouse laptops for both creatives and professionals. Normally $2,499.99, Amazon currently has the 14-inch MacBook Pro with a 10-core M1 Pro CPU, 16-core GPU, and 1TB of storage for $2,249.99 at checkout. Meanwhile, the 16-inch model with the same M1 Pro setup but 512GB of storage is $2,299.99 ($200 off) at Amazon and Best Buy. Read our review.

Gaming deals

  • Amazon Prime members can still pick up the standard Nintendo Switch at Woot for $279.99. The popular handheld normally retails for $299.99 and rarely receives a discount, which makes the current deal all the more enticing. Read our review.
  • Anyone in the market for a new gaming keyboard is in luck: Amazon currently has discounts on wireless models from both Razer and Logitech. Right now, for instance, the Razer BlackWidow V3 Mini HyperSpeed with phantom keycaps is available with linear switches for $129.99, a solid $70 discount that matches its lowest price ever.
  • The G915, an excellent full-size gaming keyboard from Logitech, is also on sale at Amazon right now for $199.99. The wireless, low-profile board normally retails for $249.99 and can be equipped with clicky, linear, or tactile switches.
  • Amazon is offering a number of discounts on gaming mice, too. You can currently the Logitech G305 wireless mouse in most colors for around $39, a cool $11 off the normal retail price. This isn’t the lowest price we’ve seen for these colorful peripherals, but it is a solid value for a piece that’s sure to become the highlight of your setup.
  • Ubisoft is now discounting Rainbow Six: Extraction along with some other games in its catalog. Normally $39.99, you can grab team Rainbow’s latest installment for $29.99, as well as the Deluxe Edition of Rainbow Six: Siege for $9.90 and the standard edition of Watch Dogs Legion for $19.80.
  • Best Buy has discounted physical copies and digital downloads of a bunch of first-party Nintendo titles. Some of the highlights on offer include Kirby Star Allies, The Legend of Zelda: Link’s Awakening, and Splatoon 2. These games typically retail for $59.99 but have been discounted to $39.99 for a limited time.
  • Speaking of first-party Nintendo titles, Animal Crossing: New Horizons is currently down to its lowest price to date ($39.99) at Urban Outfitters of all places. That’s a nice $20 off the usual price of this delightful time-sink. Read our review.

Smart home deals

  • Google’s second-gen Nest Hub is on sale for $64.99 at Best Buy, Walmart, and B&H Photo. That’s $35 off the 7-inch smart display’s usual price of $99.99, though we did see it dip as low as $49.99 during Black Friday. Today’s price is still a good deal if you’re looking to carry out basic smart display tasks, however, or if you want to use it as a smart frame for viewing a stream of family albums via Google Photos. Read our review.
  • If you want a bigger smart display with room-filling sound that’s capable of video calls, the 10-inch Google Nest Hub Max is also on sale for about $189 at Best Buy, Adorama, and Walmart. That is $40 off its regular price, matching its all-time low. Read our review.
  • The older Wi-Fi 5 Eero Pro smart router is $139 ($60 off) or available in a three-pack for $349 ($150 off) at Amazon. One router should be fine if you have a small apartment, and three is plenty to cover most small-to-average size homes with its mesh Wi-Fi signal.
  • Costco members can pick up Apple’s HomePod mini in either white or gray for $79.99 through February 23rd, or while supplies last. While not as colorful as the model Apple recently introduced, the HomeKit-ready smart speaker offers the same functionality, allowing you to control your smart home, play music, and make use of Siri’s full range of commands. It even lets you make calls and send messages, if you have an iPhone. Read our review.

General tech deals

  • Both size configurations of the Samsung Galaxy Watch 4 are selling at a new all-time low at Samsung and Amazon. Right now, you can buy the 44mm, LTE-equipped version for $249.99 (Amazon) instead of $329.99 or get $80 off the 40mm variant, which is on sale at Amazon and Samsung for $219.99. The terrific Android wearable offers a speedy interface, improved third-party app support, and plenty of health tracking features. Read our review.
  • While we personally think that buying a new phone without investing in a case should be borderline illegal, we’re not here to pass judgment. Thankfully, if you preordered the forthcoming Samsung Galaxy S22, S22 Plus, or S22 Ultra, Otterbox is offering a 10 percent discount at checkout when you purchase a screen protector and a case for any phone in the S22 lineup.
  • The Elgato Wave 3 is $119.99 ($30 off) at Amazon. The USB condenser mic has a desktop stand and is geared toward streamers and gamers alike, but it works just as well for Zoom calls.
  • Samsung’s PCIe 4.0-ready 980 Pro SSD is fast enough for a serious PC or the PlayStation 5. The 1TB model is currently on sale at Amazon for $149.99 ($80 off) without a heatsink, or you can get it with the heatsink (which is required for the PS5) for $169.99 at Amazon.
  • If you’re looking for a speaker, the Ultimate Ears Boom 3 Bluetooth speaker is also $20 off at Amazon, bringing its price down to $129.99. This speaker has been around for years, but it can bring life to any party with its big sound and magical button.
description: Salute these savings on headphones, TVs, and more.
